title: Another way with zucchinis!
abstract:
We really are trying hard to remember to check the zucchini patch each day . . . but some still seem to escape our notice till they’re over-size.
I’ve come up with another way to use them (apart from soups, slices, cakes, muffins, pickles, stuffing them etc).
method: I cut a large zucchini into 4-5cm wide circles and cut out the centres using a large scone cutter and discard this part (edible but a bit seedy, so into the compost they go).

I then drizzled my sandwich press with some olive oil and cooked the zucchini slices for a few minutes one side, before flipping over (a bit more olive oil added, S&P)  and breaking an egg into the centre of each slice, and cooking till the egg white was firm - we like our yolks runny!
I topped them with some crispy bacon pieces and some finely chopped spring onions to serve.
A dob of sour cream might have added a touch of luxury.
